operations.description: Returns the list of the features available to accounts. Account features are globally scoped.
Create an account feature. The features of the account are globally scoped. Creating a feature does not associate the feature with an account plan.

parameters.name: system_name
parameters.description: System Name of the object to be created. System names cannot be modified after creation, they are used as the key to identify the objects.

operations.description: Returns an account feature.
Updates an account feature.
Deletes an account feature.
Returns the list of the features associated to an account plan.
Associate an account feature to an account plan.
Deletes the association of an account feature to an account plan.
Returns the list of all available account plans.
Creates an account plan.

parameters.name: system_name
parameters.description: System Name of the object to be created. System names cannot be modified after creation, they are used as the key to identify the objects.

operations.description: Returns the account plan by ID.
Updates an account plan.
Deletes an account plan.
Set the account plan to be the default one. The default account plan is used unless another account plan is passed explicitly, for instance on the signup express.
Returns the list of buyer accounts (the accounts that consume your API). Filters by state are available and the results can be paginated.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 500.

operations.description: Find an account by the username or email of its users (username takes precendence over email).
Returns a buyer account.
Updates a buyer account by ID. You can modify all the fields on the account, including custom fields defined in the fields definition section of your admin portal.

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

operations.description: Deletes a buyer account. Deleting an account removes all users, applications and service subscriptions to the account.
Changes the account plan for the buyer account.

parameters.name: plan_id
parameters.description: ID of the target account plan

operations.description: Approves the account (changes the state to live). Accounts need to be approved explicitly via this API after creation. The state can also be updated by PUT on /admin/api/accounts/{id}.xml

Rejects the account (changes the state to rejected). An account can be rejected after creation, the workflow for account creation can have a validation process that ends in approving or rejecting the account submission. The state can also be updated by PUT on /admin/api/accounts/{id}.xml
Resets the state of the account to pending so that it can be approved or rejected again.
Lists all ActiveDocs specs
Creates a new ActiveDocs spec

parameters.name: system_name
parameters.description: System Name of the ActiveDocs spec. Only ASCII letters, numbers, dashes and underscores are allowed. If blank, 'system_name' will be generated from the 'name' parameter

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ActiveDocs specification in JSON format (based on Swagger)

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to publish the spec on the developer portal, or 'false' to hide it. The default value is 'false'

parameters.name: skip_swagger_validations
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to skip validation of the Swagger specification, or 'false' to validate the spec. The default value is 'false'

operations.description: Updates the ActiveDocs spec by ID

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ActiveDocs specification in JSON format (based on Swagger)

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to publish the spec on the developer portal, or 'false' to hide it

parameters.name: skip_swagger_validations
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to skip validation of the Swagger specification, or 'false' to validate the spec

operations.description: Deletes the ActiveDocs spec by ID
Returns the list of features of the application plan.
Associates a feature to an application plan.

operations.descripttion: Removes the association of a feature to an application plan.

operations.description: Returns the list of all limits associated to an application plan.
Returns the list of all limits associated to a metric of an application plan.
Adds a limit to a metric of an application plan. All applications with the application plan (application_plan_id) will be constrained by this new limit on the metric (metric_id).
Returns a limit on a metric of an application plan.
Updates a limit on a metric of an application plan.
Deletes a limit on a metric of an application plan.
Returns the list of all pricing rules associated to a metric of an application plan.
Creates a pricing rule for an associated application plan.

operations.summary: Pricing Rules List per Application Plan
operations.description: Returns the list of all pricing rules associated to an application plan.
Returns the list of all application plans across services. Note that application plans are scoped by service.
Returns the list of all application plans of a service.
Creates an application plan.

parameters.name: system_name
parameters.description: System Name of the object to be created. System names cannot be modified after creation, they are used as the key to identify the objects.

operations.description: Returns and application plan.
Updates an application plan.
Deletes an application plan.
Makes the application plan the default one. New applications will be assigned to the default plan unless an application_plan_id is explicity passed (e.g. on the signup express operation).
Returns the list of applications across all services. Note that applications are scoped by service and can be paginated.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 500.

operations.description: Finds an application by keys used on the integration of your API and 3scale's Service Management API or by application ID.

parameters.name: user_key
parameters.description: user_key of the application (for user_key authentication mode).

parameters.name: app_id
parameters.description: app_id of the application (for app_id/app_key and oauth authentication modes).

operations.description: Returns the account plan associated to an account.
Lists app keys of the application.
Adds a key of an application (valid only on the authentication mode app_id/app_key or oauth). There are maximum 5 app_keys per application.
Deletes a key of an application (valid only on the authentication mode app_id/app_key or oauth). An application may have to have at least one app_key (controlled by settings).
Lists referrer filters of the application.
Adds a referrer filter to an application. Referrer filters limit API requests by domain or IP ranges.
Deletes a referrer filter of an application. Referrer filters limit API requests by domain or IP ranges.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of referrer filter to be deleted.

operations.description: Returns the list of application of an account.

Create an application. The application object can be extended with Fields Definitions in the Admin Portal where you can add/remove fields, for instance token (string), age (int), third name (string optional), etc.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the application to be created.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the application to be created.

parameters.name: user_key
parameters.description: User Key (API Key) of the application to be created.

parameters.name: application_id
parameters.description: App ID of the application to be created.

parameters.name: application_key
parameters.description: App Key(s) of the application to be created.

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

operations.description: Returns the application by id.
Updates an application. All fields of the application object can be updated except the id and the app_id (when using OAuth or app_id/app_key authentication pattern).

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

operations.description: Changes the application plan of an application.

parameters.name: plan_id
parameters.description: ID of the new application plan.

operations.description: Creates a customized application plan for the application.

apis.description: Decustomizes the plan of an application.

operations.description: Deletes the customized application plan of the application. After removing the customization the application will be constrained by the original application plan.
Accepts an application (changes the state to live). Once the state is live the application can be used on API requests.
Suspends an application (changes the state to suspended). Suspending an application will stop the application from authorizing API requests.
Resume a suspended application. Once a suspended application is resumed it will be authorized on API requests.
Returns the list of users of an account. The list can be filtered by the state or role of the users.

Creates a new user of the account (account_id). Do not forget to activate the user otherwise he/she will be unable to sign-in. After creation the default state is pending and the default role is member. The user object can be extended using Fields Definitions in the Admin Portal. You can add/remove fields, for instance token (string), age (int), third name (string optional), etc.

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

operations.description: Returns the user of an account.

Updates the user of an account. You can update any field, not only those in the form of the ActiveDocs but all the fields that belong to the User object. Remember that you can define custom fields on your Admin Portal.

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

operations.description: Deletes a user of an account. The last user can't be deleted
Changes the role of the user to member.
Changes the role of the user to admin.
Changes the state of the user to suspended. A suspended user cannot sign-in.
Change the state of the user back to active.
Activate the user of an account. A user is created in the pending state and needs to be activated before he/she is able to sign-in.

Associates credit card tokens and billing address to an account. This operation is only required if you use your own credit card capture method. These tokens are the ones required by Authorize.net, ogone, braintree, payment express and merchant e solutions

parameters.name: credit_card_token
parameters.description: The token returned by the payment gateway. client_id if you're using braintree (In that case, the first credit card will be used).

parameters.name: credit_card_authorize_net_payment_profile_token
parameters.description: Authorize.net payment profile token. Not used for other payment gateways

parameters.name: credit_card_expiration_year
parameters.description: Year of expiration of credit card. Two digit number

parameters.name: credit_card_expiration_month
parameters.description: Month of expiration of credit card. Two digit number

parameters.name: billing_address_name
parameters.description: Name of the person/company to bill

parameters.name: billing_address_address
parameters.description: Address associated to the credit card

parameters.name: credit_card_partial_number
parameters.description: Last four digits on the credit card

operations.description: Removes all credit card info of an account.

Update the service.
Delete the service. Deleting a service removes all applications and service subscriptions.

This request allows you to reproduce a sign-up from a buyer in a single API call. It will create an Account, an Admin User for the account, and optionally an Application with its keys. If the plan_id is not passed, the default plan will be used instead. You can add additional custom parameters in Fields Definition on your Admin Portal.

parameters.name: org_name
parameters.description: Organization Name of the buyer account.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the admin user (on the new buyer account).

parameters.name: account_plan_id
parameters.description: ID of the account plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).

parameters.name: service_plan_id
parameters.description: ID of the service plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).

parameters.name: application_plan_id
parameters.description: ID of the application plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

operations.description: Lists the users of the provider account. You can apply filters by state and/or role.

Creates a new user in the provider account. Do not forget to activate it, otherwise he/she will not be able to sign-in. After creation the default state is pending and the default role is member. The user object can be extended using Fields Definitions in the Admin Portal where you can add/remove fields, for instance token (string), age (int), third name (string optional), etc.

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

operations.description: Gets the user of the provider account by ID.

Modifies the user of the provider account by ID. You can update any field, not only those in the form of the ActiveDocs but also fields that belong to the User object. Remember that you can define custom fields on your Admin Portal.

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

operations.description: Deletes the user of the provider account by ID.

operations.summary: User Change Role to Member (provider account)
operations.description: Changes the role of the user of the provider account to member.

operations.summary: User Change Role to Admin (provider account)
operations.description: Changes the role of the provider account to admin (full rights and privileges).

Changes the state of the user of the provider account to suspended, which removes the user's ability to sign-in. You can also perform this operation with a PUT on /admin/api/users/{id}.xml to change the state parameter.
Revokes the suspension of a user of the provider account. You can also perform this operation with a PUT on /admin/api/users/{id}.xml to change the state parameter.
Changes the state of the user of the provider account to active (after sign-up). You can also perform this operation with a PUT on /admin/api/users/{id}.xml to change the state parameter.

Lists of webhooks that could not be delivered to your end-point after 5 trials. A webhook is considered delivered if your end-point responds with a 200, otherwise it retries 5 times at 60 second intervals.

Deletes failed delivery records. It is advisible to delete the records past the time of the last webhook failure that was received instead of deleting them all. Between the GET and the DELETE other webhooks failures may have arrived.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Only failed webhook deliveries whose time is less than or equal to the passed time are destroyed (if used).
